stream_context.summary: Kaze live-designs an end-game “Ice Castle” stage: defines visual style, lays out rooms and star objectives, and experiments with technical methods for reflective ice bricks while chatting with Biobak and Zeina.

development_findings.summary: Finalized general art direction: dark blue, light blue, white palette with reflective ice bricks to give an eerie, late-game ambience similar to Tick Tock Clock.
development_findings.quote: The color palette is going to be dark blue, light blue and white … I want you to think about levels like Tick Tock Clock when you think about this here.

development_findings.summary: Overall castle layout chosen: H-shaped/U-shaped structure with two towers linked by a bridge, central foyer with slippery stairs, basement, and exterior snowfield.
development_findings.quote: I’m thinking the general shape of the castle will be something kind of like this … towers in front and back of the castle, bridge connecting the H shape.

development_findings.summary: Defined six star concepts: 1) foyer star visible early but reachable later, 2) platforming gauntlet, 3) boss fight vs. giant Raven, 4) red-coin star outside or courtyard, 5) 8-bit pipe (Mario Land 1) challenge, 6) snowman cave path with rolling-head snowman.
development_findings.quote: So far I actually only have five stars, but … Starfree obviously the boss fight with the Raven.

development_findings.summary: Basement mechanic: damage-over-time cold haze punctuated by safe fire spots forcing dashes between heat sources.
development_findings.quote: The basement of the castle is going to be ice cold … you can go to the fire as a safe spot and then you just kind of have to dash to the next fire.

development_findings.summary: New platforming gimmicks proposed: ice wave generator you ride, hexagonal rotating ice prisms altering wall-jump angle, sliding ice cubes over spikes, gusting wind, appearing paths.
development_findings.quote: Imagine it generates ice waves shaped like this that go towards you, and you’re gonna have to jump onto the back of it.

development_findings.summary: Technical experiment: CPU-generated normal maps per wall orientation for real-time fake reflections; deemed expensive, so fallback to camera-dependent scrolling shine texture; plan to mix both.
development_findings.quote: I’m thinking there’s gonna be a normal map and a brightness map … but it has a limitation, like it’s expensive and we can only do six walls at the same time.

development_findings.summary: Kaze wrote a new custom OS (rewrite/update of Libultra) for N64 to gain control and future optimizations.
development_findings.quote: Did I tell you guys that I wrote a new OS for my N64? It’s all done now … it gives me a lot more control.

development_findings.summary: Intends dual release on PC and original N64, seeing it as strong marketing.
development_findings.quote: Dual release on PC and N64 at the same time is perfectly possible.

development_findings.summary: Reiterated commitment to release full source code despite community doubts.
development_findings.quote: Despite what people seem to think I will release the source code.

development_findings.summary: Prefers new NEMU64 emulator for accuracy; currently beta-testing unreleased build.
development_findings.quote: The new NEMU64 is actually really nice. It is more accurate than Parallel, for sure … NEMU isn’t publicly released yet. I’m just having a beta testing build.

context_findings.summary: Kaze shows playful frustration with haircut (done by Zeina) and bot spam; reflects light-hearted, self-deprecating tone.
context_findings.quote: My wife just kind of messed up my hair and now I look like this.

context_findings.summary: Expresses disdain for overly commercial fan references and insists on avoiding ‘shoutouts’ style jokes in level design.
context_findings.quote: We’re not doing that fanboy type shit.

biobak.summary: Collaborated off-stream with Kaze to prototype art style and provided initial ice-brick textures that looked better than Kaze’s own tests.
biobak.quote: I have been talking to Biobak … he had some neat ideas and I had some neat ideas.

zeina.summary: Authored an ‘icy bricks’ combiner material and started modelling the Raven boss.
zeina.quote: Zeina made an icy bricks combiner … Zeina’s making the raven. That looks pretty nice.

key_stories.title: Settling the Ice-Brick Reflection Technique
key_stories.summary: Kaze and Biobak test multiple methods for making walls look like shiny ice: CPU-generated normal maps vs. camera-scrolled shine textures. After seeing severe quantization artifacts on hardware, they opt for a hybrid approach.
key_stories.challenge: Need convincing reflective ice visuals within N64 limits.
key_stories.process: Prototyped CPU normal-map reflections (expensive) and simpler scrolling shine textures; viewed results in Blender and on console.
key_stories.outcome: Decided to mix both techniques depending on room, using IA8 textures to reduce artifacts.
key_stories.key_quote: It has a limitation—it's expensive and we can only do six walls at the same time—so we can use both and have the spikes in some places and the actual brick walls in other places.

key_stories.title: Designing the Cold-Haze Basement
key_stories.summary: Kaze imagines a basement so cold that Mario takes damage unless he reaches fireplaces. The mechanic adds tension and variety to the castle.
key_stories.challenge: Create unique gameplay for lower section of level.
key_stories.process: Sketches concept live, discusses visual fog and safe-zone fires.
key_stories.outcome: Basement room added to plan; fog and DOT cold confirmed.
key_stories.key_quote: The basement of the castle is going to be ice cold—damage over time ice cold—and there’s going to be fire that melts the ice around it; you dash to the next fire.

key_stories.title: Writing a New N64 Operating System
key_stories.summary: Off-stream, Kaze rewrote Libultra to gain tighter control and performance, enabling future optimizations across the whole project.
key_stories.challenge: Original Libultra limits flexibility and speed.
key_stories.process: Stripped Libultra to only needed parts, then rebuilt modules for efficiency.
key_stories.outcome: New OS finished; further optimizations planned.
key_stories.key_quote: I kinda just took Libultra and ripped out only the parts I needed, and now I'm putting back the parts in a way that hopefully is a lot better.
